topicmeta.shortdesc: Datasets can be exported to consuming applications and tools.
View dataset destinations on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.
Define a new dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.
View information about a dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.
Modify information for a dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.
Delete a dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.

concept.domains: (topic concept) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d)
concept.title: Dataset Destinations
concept.shortdesc: Datasets can be exported to consuming applications and tools.

conbody.p: Datasets can be consumed by querying them through the PHEMI Central RESTful API or by configuring a "destination" in the Management and Governance Console.

Dataset destinations are configured by the PHEMI Administrator. The destination is characterized in terms of the connection type, the network parameters, the destination database and schema names, and the user credentials for logging on to the destination.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: View Dataset Destinations
task.shortdesc: View dataset destinations on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.

step.cmd: Open the System Configuration page, by clicking the System Configuration icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The System Configuration page opens on the Password Policy screen.

step.cmd: Click the Dataset Destinations tab.
At the right of the Choose Destination to Edit field, click the drop-down arrow to see configured dataset destinations.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Create a Dataset Destination
task.shortdesc: Define a new dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.

context.p: To create a new dataset destination:

step.cmd: Open the System Configuration page, by clicking the System Configuration icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The System Configuration page opens on the Password Policy screen.

step.cmd: Click the Dataset Destinations tab.
To the right of the Choose Destination to Edit field, click the New Destination button.
Enter the destination details.

chdesc.p: Mandatory. Provide a name for the destination.
Mandatory. The destination type. Supported values are as follows:

ul.li: MySQL. The destination is a MySQL database. Both ODBC and JDBC connection types are supported.
HANA. The destination is a SAP HANA database.

chrow.chdesc: Mandatory. The IP address of the destination, in dotted decimal format.
Mandatory. The name of the destination database.
Mandatory. The name of the schema being used in the destination database.
Mandatory. The user name for logging on to the destination.
Mandatory. The password for logging on to the destination.
Mandatory. Re-enter the password to ensure it is correct.

step.cmd: Click the Save Destination button to save the new destination.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: View Dataset Destination Information
task.shortdesc: View information about a dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.

context.p: To view information for a dataset destination:

step.cmd: Open the System Configuration page, by clicking the System Configuration icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The System Configuration page opens on the Password Policy screen.

step.cmd: Click the Dataset Destinations tab.
At the right of the Choose Destination to Edit field, click the drop-down arrow to see configured dataset destinations. Select the destination you want to view.
The Destination Details screen opens, showing information for the selected dataset.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Modify Dataset Destination Information
task.shortdesc: Modify information for a dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.

context.p: To modify information for a dataset destination:

step.cmd: Open the System Configuration page, by clicking the System Configuration icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The System Configuration page opens on the Password Policy screen.

step.cmd: Click the Dataset Destinations tab.
At the right of the Choose Destination to Edit field, click the drop-down arrow to see configured dataset destinations. Select the destination you want to modify.

The Destination Details screen opens, showing information for the selected dataset. What do these fields mean?Define a new dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.
Click the Edit Destination button. The fields on the Destination Details screen become editable, and the Delete Destination buttons and Save Destination buttons appear.
Make your changes. If you need to change the destination password information, click the Modify Connection Password button.
step.info: The Set Password pane opens underneath the other destination information.

step.cmd: Complete your changes, then click the Save Destination button to save the changed information.

task.domains: (topic task) (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic task strictTaskbody-c)
task.title: Delete a Dataset Destination
task.shortdesc: Delete a dataset destination on the Dataset Destinations screen of the System Configuration page.

step.cmd: Open the System Configuration page, by clicking the System Configuration icon in the left navigation bar.

info.p: The System Configuration page opens on the Password Policy screen.

step.cmd: Click the Dataset Destinations tab.
At the right of the Choose Destination to Edit field, click the drop-down arrow to see configured dataset destinations. Select the destination you want to delete.
The Destination Details screen opens, showing information for the selected dataset.
Click the Edit Destination button. The fields on the Destination Details screen become editable, and the Delete Destination buttons and Save Destination buttons appear.
Click the Delete Destination button. The system asks you to confirm permanent deletion. Click Delete.
